comments.creator: anicesteak@gmail.com
comments.raw_text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.0; WOW64; rv:9.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/9.0.1
Build ID: 20111220165912

Steps to reproduce:

I upgraded to FF 9.0.1 and tried to use FF as I usually do but links weren't opening, etc.


Actual results:

I clicked a link, and nothing happeneD>


Expected results:

The link should have opened.  I realized that if I do a slow click (e.g. 1/4 second) then the clicks will register.  Otherwise everything else seems to work, but this is really annoying.
comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.0; WOW64; rv:9.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/9.0.1
Build ID: 20111220165912

Steps to reproduce:

I upgraded to FF 9.0.1 and tried to use FF as I usually do but links weren't opening, etc.


Actual results:

I clicked a link, and nothing happeneD>


Expected results:

The link should have opened.  I realized that if I do a slow click (e.g. 1/4 second) then the clicks will register.  Otherwise everything else seems to work, but this is really annoying.
comments.author: anicesteak@gmail.com
bugzilla@mversen.de
comments.text:
Does it work in the Firefox safemode ?
http://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Safe+Mode
comments.creator: bugzilla@mversen.de
comments.raw_text:
Does it work in the Firefox safemode ?
http://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Safe+Mode

comments.text:
I suspected this problem may have been an extension related issue as I previously identified an extension related issue with a hang in FF3 and a cpu hog in FF4.  I started by disabling the extensions one by one until the problem disappeared, and then started enabling the extensions until the problem reappeared.

The problem is caused by the extension TryAgain, version 3.4.6 and is 100% repeatable,
comments.author: anicesteak@gmail.com
comments.raw_text:
I suspected this problem may have been an extension related issue as I previously identified an extension related issue with a hang in FF3 and a cpu hog in FF4.  I started by disabling the extensions one by one until the problem disappeared, and then started enabling the extensions until the problem reappeared.

The problem is caused by the extension TryAgain, version 3.4.6 and is 100% repeatable,
